Sneak Peek WIP Firefox Desktop Support Question "Barcode": an infographic of Firefox Support Questions. Each "slice" of the barcode is a support question arranged ascending chronologically: bottom row is OS: Windows=windows emoji, macOS=apple, ?=unknown OS, next row up is whether it's tagged Sync; if so , final 7 rows up are the integer id of the support question e.g. support.mozilla.org/questions/<id> e.g support.mozilla.org/1406695
Ruby code to generate the "barcode": https://github.com/rtanglao/firefox-emoji-barcode/blob/main/createDailyFirefoxEmojiBarcode.rb

THREAD 1/2: How To convert all Grafista glyphs to 101px X1 01 px images: by running a script from fontforge (from [Stack Overflow: How do I convert a TTF into individual PNG character images?](https://superuser.com/questions/1337567/how-do-i-convert-a-ttf-into-individual-png-character-images))

2/2:
0. install fontforge
1. Create a file exportGlyphs.py:

```python
import os
from fontforge import *
font = open(os.sys.argv[1])
for glyph in font:
if font[glyph].isWorthOutputting():
font[glyph].export(font[glyph].glyphname + ".png")
```

3. Then run fontforge as:

`fontforge -script exportGlyphs.py YOURFONT.ttf`
e.g.

```bash
fontforge -script exportGlyphs.py /Users/rtanglao/Downloads/Grafista-Regular.ttf
```

Bingo. A whole bunch of .png files for each glyph.

how to create a 1080p video with 2 frames per second 0.125 seconds per image from 1500 JPEGS from a Canon EOS RP with 16mm RF lens:

```bash

```

Today I Learned, RMagick doesn't support `smush` to align horizontal images at the bottom but MiniMagick does! https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60357036/imagemagick-montage-how-to-align-images-to-bottom

```ruby
def montage_images_horizontally(image_to_be_appended, image)
MiniMagick::Tool::Magick.new do |m|
m.gravity('south')
m << image
m << image_to_be_appended
m.smush.+(10)
m << image
end
end
```

```
* Blogged this in a post entitled: RMagick doesn't support smush to align horizontal images at the bottom but MiniMagick does; you need gravity set to south to anchor images to the bottom ie. south
* http://rolandtanglao.com/2023/09/15/p1-rmagic-smush-horizontal-montages-bottom-aligned/
```

`wget --execute="robots = off" --spider --force-html -r -l 0 $url 2>&1 | grep -e '^--' | grep -e '\.\(jpeg\|mp3\|png\|gif\|jpg\) 2>stderr_mp3_jpg_png_urls.txt>_level_0_mp3_jpg_png_urls.txt` appears to get a list of URLs from a WordPress (or any?) website (via https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2804467/spider-a-website-and-return-urls-only )
where url="www.barbandroland.com" for example

The URLS are in a bizarre format with 2 spaces after the time e.g.:
`--2024-04-26 21:58:51-- http://www.barbandroland.com/_photos/Sun,%20Jul%2011,%202004%2003_27_11%20PM.jpg`

the 2 spaces throws off awk so remove one of the spaces and proceed :-)
`cat _level_0_mp3_jpg_png_urls.txt | sed "s/-- / /g" | awk '{ print $3 }' | grep _photos `
`cat _level_0_mp3_jpg_png_urls.txt | sed "s/-- / /g" | awk '{ print $3 }' | grep _photos | > photo_urls.txt ; mkdir PHOTOS; cd !$ ; cat ../photo_urls.txt | xargs -n 1 wget `
replace `'` with '`'` to keep bash and wget happy :-) (first `'` occurs at line 410
`tail --lines=+411 ../photo_urls.txt| xargs -n 1 wget`

of course that leads to the next layer of the onion :-)
`--2024-04-27 08:31:40-- http://www.barbandroland.com/_photos/Thu,%20Jul%2029,%202004%2006:30:16%20PM.jpg
Resolving www.barbandroland.com (www.barbandroland.com)... 64.91.252.138
Connecting to www.barbandroland.com (www.barbandroland.com)|64.91.252.138|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 404 Not Found
2024-04-27 08:31:41 ERROR 404: Not Found.` <-- what is wrong wtih the URL? do commas need to URL encoded?
